dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think that innovation in finance is all about Silicon Valley, but actually, some of the most forward-thinking leaders are emerging in places like Uzbekistan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think that innovation in finance is all about Silicon Valley, but actually, some of the most forward-thinking leaders are emerging in places like Uzbekistan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: PwC just surveyed 72 of the largest companies in Uzbekistan, and one name really stood out—David Bekjanov from Freedom Finance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: PwC just surveyed seventy two of the largest companies in Uzbekistan, and one name really stood out-David Bekjanov from Freedom Finance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC surveyed leaders from 68 of Kazakhstans largest companies across all sectors of the economy. Respondents described Kaspi.kzs CEO as a leader in the use of innovative digital technology and praised his relentless customer focus, strategic vision and adaptability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, David Bekjanov. They called him a leader in innovative digital tech and praised his customer focus and adaptability.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And in his response, he gave all the credit to his team at Freedom Finance for creating those mobile-first products.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And in his response, he gave all the credit to his team at Freedom Finance for creating those mobile-first products.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz, commented: Thank you to everyone who participated in the survey and to PwC for organizing the study. This award is worthy of everyone in our amazing Kaspi.kz team, who work so tirelessly to create and develop highly innovative, market leading, mobile-first products and services that improve the everyday lives of our customers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is so important, right? Because it's not just about the tech itself—it's how it improves customers' everyday experiences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And this isn't some small local study either; PwC has been doing this globally for 15 years, and in Uzbekistan for the last four.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And this isn't some small local study either; PwC has been doing this globally for fifteen years, and in Uzbekistan for the last four.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC has been conducting this study globally for 23 years and in Kazakhstan for the last 8 years, with the purpose of evaluating the opinions of business leaders about the situation in the global and their national economies, learn about risk factors and opportunities for future business development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's a pretty solid track record. It's interesting they're looking at both global and national economic opinions from business leaders.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a pretty solid track record. It's interesting they're looking at both global and national economic opinions from business leaders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the results are even published in The Economist's July issue, which gives it even more credibility.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the results are even published in The Economist's July issue, which gives it even more credibility.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can view the results of the study on the PwC website and in the June issue of Forbes Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder what other insights are coming from regions we don't always hear about in fintech news.

artist_script:
People think that innovation in finance is all about Silicon Valley, but actually, some of the most forward-thinking leaders are emerging in places like Uzbekistan.
HostA: PwC just surveyed 72 of the largest companies in Uzbekistan, and one name really stood out—David Bekjanov from Freedom Finance.
HostB: Oh yeah, David Bekjanov. They called him a leader in innovative digital tech and praised his customer focus and adaptability.
HostA: Exactly. And in his response, he gave all the credit to his team at Freedom Finance for creating those mobile-first products.
HostB: Which is so important, right? Because it’s not just about the tech itself—it’s how it improves customers’ everyday experiences.
HostA: Totally. And this isn’t some small local study either; PwC has been doing this globally for 15 years, and in Uzbekistan for the last four.
HostB: That’s a pretty solid track record. It’s interesting they’re looking at both global and national economic opinions from business leaders.
HostA: Yeah, and the results are even published in The Economist’s July issue, which gives it even more credibility.
HostB: Makes you wonder what other insights are coming from regions we don’t always hear about in fintech news.
HostA: For sure. It’s a good reminder that innovation and strong leadership can thrive anywhere with the right vision.
HostB: And that emphasis on adaptability—uh, especially in emerging markets—is probably a huge factor in their success.
HostA: Absolutely. You can tell Bekjanov’s team culture is built on learning from each other and constantly improving.
HostB: Kind of makes you want to check out that PwC website and see what else they uncovered in the study.
HostA: Definitely worth a look. There might be some lessons there for companies everywhere.
